DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Version Plan Study Site Number Range ISO21090.URG.INT.POS.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An integer falling within minimum and maximum bounds that specifies how many study sites are expected to participate in the conduction of the study. NOTE(S): Relevant before specific sites have been selected. Can be derived once sites have been selected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Protocol Version Plan Study Site Number Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains URG so that the values are integers greater than zero.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
